roleset.name: introduce nucleic acids into a recipient cell

role.descr: entity inserted into the cell (e.g. nucleid acid)

example.name: example with agent
example.text: To establish that the cloned protein displays serine racemase activity, we transfected HEK293 cells that do not possess endogenous D-serine.
example.arg: HEK293 cells that do not possess endogenous D-serine

example.name: example with instrument
example.text: In cells transfected with wild-type EGFR, MEK inhibition led to feedback activation of phospho-ERBB3 and phosho-EGFR, recapitulating the results we had observed in our panel of cancer cell lines (Figure 6A).

roleset.name: simultaneously transfect with two, unrelated nucleic acids, one of which carries a marker gene

role.descr: nucleic acid(s) inserted into the cell

example.name: all ARGs
example.text: To confirm this model, we cotransfected HNF-4 expression vector with PPARa expression vector into HeLa cells.
example.arg: HNF-4 expression vector with PPARa expression vector

example.name: ARG2 with list
example.text: Tumor cells cotransfected with interleukin-7 and B7.1 genes induce CD25 and CD28 on tumor-infiltrating T lymphocytes and are strong vaccines.
